results.name: Number of steps for knight to reach (n,0) on infinite chessboard.
comment: The knight starts at (0,0) and we count the least number of steps. Row 1 of the array at A065775. - _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 20 2010
Apparently also the minimum number of steps of the (1,3)-leaper to reach (n,n) starting at (0,0). - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 05 2018
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
Francis N. Castro, Oscar E. González, Luis A. Medina, Generalized exponential sums and the power of computers, Involve, vol. 11 (2018), Issue 1, p. 127-142. Also, second and third authors' copies.
example: a(1)=3 counts these moves: (0,0) to (2,1) to (0,2) to (1,0). - _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 20 2010
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[x (3 - x + x^2 - x^3 - 2 x^4 + 2 x^5)/((1-x)^2 (1+x) (1+x^2)), {x, 0, 100}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 06 2018 *)
